segment.source: Deploy the AppLocker policy into production (Windows 10)
segment.target: Deploy the AppLocker policy into production (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes the tasks that should be completed before you deploy AppLocker application control settings.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes the tasks that should be completed before you deploy AppLocker application control settings.

segment.source: Deploy the AppLocker policy into production
segment.target: Deploy the AppLocker policy into production

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes the tasks that should be completed before you deploy AppLocker application control settings.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes the tasks that should be completed before you deploy AppLocker application control settings.

segment.source: After successfully testing and modifying the AppLocker policy for each Group Policy Object (GPO), you are ready to deploy the enforcement settings into production.
segment.target: After successfully testing and modifying the AppLocker policy for each Group Policy Object (GPO), you are ready to deploy the enforcement settings into production.

segment.source: For most organizations, this means switching the AppLocker enforcement setting from Audit only to Enforce rules.
segment.target: For most organizations, this means switching the AppLocker enforcement setting from Audit only to Enforce rules.

segment.source: However, it is important to follow the deployment plan that you created earlier.
segment.target: However, it is important to follow the deployment plan that you created earlier.

segment.source: For more info, see the AppLocker Design Guide.
segment.target: For more info, see the AppLocker Design Guide.

segment.source: Depending on the needs of different business groups in your organization, you might deploy different enforcement settings for linked GPOs.
segment.target: Depending on the needs of different business groups in your organization, you might deploy different enforcement settings for linked GPOs.

segment.source: Understand your design decisions
segment.target: Understand your design decisions

segment.source: Before you deploy an AppLocker policy, you should determine:
segment.target: Before you deploy an AppLocker policy, you should determine:

segment.source: For each business group, which applications will be controlled and in what manner.
segment.target: For each business group, which applications will be controlled and in what manner.

segment.source: For more info, see Create a list of apps deployed to each business group.
segment.target: For more info, see Create a list of apps deployed to each business group.

segment.source: How to handle requests for application access.
segment.target: How to handle requests for application access.

segment.source: For info about what to consider when developing your support policies, see Plan for AppLocker policy management.
segment.target: For info about what to consider when developing your support policies, see Plan for AppLocker policy management.

segment.source: How to manage events, including forwarding events.
segment.target: How to manage events, including forwarding events.

segment.source: For info about event management in AppLocker, see Monitor app usage with AppLocker.
segment.target: For info about event management in AppLocker, see Monitor app usage with AppLocker.

segment.source: Your GPO structure, including how to include policies generated by Software Restriction Policies and AppLocker policies.
segment.target: Your GPO structure, including how to include policies generated by Software Restriction Policies and AppLocker policies.

segment.source: For more info, see Determine the Group Policy structure and rule enforcement.
segment.target: For more info, see Determine the Group Policy structure and rule enforcement.

segment.source: For info about how AppLocker deployment is dependent on design decisions, see Understand AppLocker policy design decisions.
segment.target: For info about how AppLocker deployment is dependent on design decisions, see Understand AppLocker policy design decisions.

segment.source: AppLocker deployment methods
segment.target: AppLocker deployment methods

segment.source: If you have configured a reference device, you can create and update your AppLocker policies on this device, test the policies, and then export the policies to the appropriate GPO for distribution.
segment.target: If you have configured a reference device, you can create and update your AppLocker policies on this device, test the policies, and then export the policies to the appropriate GPO for distribution.

segment.source: Another method is to create the policies and set the enforcement setting on Audit only, then observe the events that are generated.
segment.target: Another method is to create the policies and set the enforcement setting on Audit only, then observe the events that are generated.

segment.source: Use a reference device to create and maintain AppLocker policies
segment.target: Use a reference device to create and maintain AppLocker policies

segment.source: This topic describes the steps to use an AppLocker reference computer to prepare application control policies for deployment by using Group Policy or other means.
segment.target: This topic describes the steps to use an AppLocker reference computer to prepare application control policies for deployment by using Group Policy or other means.

segment.source: Deploy AppLocker policies by using the enforce rules setting
segment.target: Deploy AppLocker policies by using the enforce rules setting

segment.source: This topic describes the steps to deploy the AppLocker policy by changing the enforcement setting to Audit only or to Enforce rules.
segment.target: This topic describes the steps to deploy the AppLocker policy by changing the enforcement setting to Audit only or to Enforce rules.

segment.target: See also
